action.primary: Clears Heat from the Heart and Liver and alleviates spasms

indications: Childhood convulsions, epilepsy and eclampsia from Liver Fire (Generates Wind)

action.primary: Clears Heat and resolves Fire toxicity

indications: Fire toxicity with various hot, toxic lesions including sores and carbuncles, burning hemorrhoids and sore throat (topical application is especially effective at eliminating pain)

action.primary: Clears and drains Liver Heat and benefits the eyes

indications: Sever cases of red, painful eyes
It can be used topically and internally

action.primary: Clears Heat and eliminates childhood nutritional impairment

indications: Childhood nutritional impairment, primarily marked by Heat

contraindications: Contraindicated where there is Cold from Deficiency (no true Heat).
incompatibilities: Do not use with Rx. Rehmanniae #{ShengDiHuang} Sheng Di Huang.
Do not use with Rx. Stephaniae #{HanFangJi} Han Fang Ji.

useCases: Topically to relieve hemorrhoidal swelling, pain and inflammation due to toxic Heat
Childhood nutritional impairment with hot limbs
Sore throat due to toxic Heat
Jaundice due to Damp-Heat and toxins

notes: Various sources include these additional actions for this herb: reduces swelling and pain, kills intestinal parasites, dilates the Lungs and tonifies the Spleen and Stomach.
Due to its high cost, Vessica Fella Bovis Niu Dan, cattle Gall Bladder or Fel Porcus Zhu Dan, pig Gall Bladder are often substituted. Their actions are similar but weaker and require higher dosages.
There are three grades according to color: 1) translucent, 2) yellowish-green, 3) dark brown or green.
It is on the endangered species list. – do not use.
It cools Heat relieves toxicity, brightens eyes and relieves spasms and convulsions.
Xiong Dan mixed in warm water as a drink is used for eclampsia.
Because its acids are good at dissolving gallstones, it is used as a preventative for gallstone attacks.
It is used alone Internally or topically for eye disorders.
CONTRAINDICATIONS Contraindicated where there is Cold from Deficiency (no true Heat). Use caution during pregnancy. Use caution with Liver disease. INCOMPATIBILITIES HERB/DRUG INTERACTIONS
Contraindicated where there is Cold from Deficiency (no true Heat).
